hanzi-su-wiki:
昨

Значения

Прошлый, предыдущий

Мнемоника

Мелькание дней 日. Прошёл день, внезапно 乍 оказавшийся уже вчерашним.

yesterday
вчерашний день

purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 乍 indicates the sound; 日 (day) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
昨天 [ zuó tiān ]: yesterday
昨晚 [ zuó wǎn ]: yesterday evening; last night
昨日 [ zuó rì ]: yesterday
昨夜 [ zuó yè ]: last night
昨儿 [ zuó r ]: (coll.) yesterday
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 日 [ rì ] sun; day; daytime
    • 乍 [ zhà ] first time, for the first time, suddenly
heisig_chinese_memo: One can use a simple word play to remember this character - the day that I saw before today was yesterday.
koohiiStory1: One can use a simple word play to remember this character - the day that I saw before today was yesterday.
koohiiStory2: Yester-DAY, all my troubles seemed SAW far away...
jp_example_words:
一昨日(おととい): day before yesterday
一昨年(おととし): year before last
一昨昨日(さきおととい): two days before yesterday
一昨日(いっさくじつ): day before yesterday
一昨年(いっさくねん): year before last
昨(さく): last (year), yesterday
昨日(きのう): yesterday
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: With the right key you can unlock the sun to yesterday, or a previous day. The sun is in charge of the day changes, so if you use a key to unlock it, you can control the flow of time and return to yesterday, or a previous day in the past. Behold the power of the sun.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine having the power to control time like this. Picture yourself unlocking the sun to go back in time. Feel the heat of the sun and the bright light in your eyes as you unlock the door to the past.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Time traveling to a previous time, like yesterday, can be rough on the body. As such, you wear a small sack (さく) to hold your valuables while you’re ripped through the sands of time. The sack keeps your important stuff from getting lost. The sack holds your key to the sun as well.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine wearing this sack as you’re sucked through the vortex of time and space. Feel yourself spinning around as you hurtle back into yesterday.
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 作 (つくる、サク создавать, делать)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: although (乍) a day (日) it's yesterday
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: One can use a simple word play to remember this character - the day that I saw before today was yesterday.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " day " to " at first " sound. " Yesterday " means the day before today. Such as "Historical Records. Family of Foreign Relations": "The King of Han has a miserable heart, and pity Bo Ji, it is a lucky day to call. Bo Ji said: "Last evening night, my concubine dreamed that the blue dragon took possession of my belly." "Shi Shuo Xin Yu. "Appreciation": "Talking to scholars yesterday makes people forget their fatigue."

" Yesterday " also refers to the past and the past. For example, Tao Yuanming of the Eastern Jin Dynasty "Returning Words": "It is not far to be lost. I feel that today is true but yesterday is not." Liu Yuxi of the Tang Dynasty "Remembered yesterday and his old friend, the first farewell to Xiangjiang River."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " day " to the sound of " at a glance ". " Yesterday " means the day before today and also refers to the past in general.
humanum_full_description:
從「日」，「乍」聲。「昨」表示今天的前一天。如《史記．外戚世家》：「漢王心慘然，憐薄姬，是日召而幸之。薄姬曰：『昨暮夜妾夢蒼龍據吾腹。』」《世說新語．賞譽》：「昨與士少語，遂使人忘疲。」

　　「昨」也泛指過去、過往。如東晉陶淵明〈歸去來辭〉：「寔迷途其未遠，覺今是而昨非。」唐代劉禹錫〈重至衡陽傷柳儀曹〉：「憶昨與故人，湘江岸頭別。」
humanum_short_description: 從「日」，「乍」聲。「昨」表示今天的前一天，也泛指過去。

從「 日 」，「 乍 」聲。「 昨 」表示今天的前一天。如《史記．外戚世家》：「漢王心慘然，憐薄姬，是日召而幸之。薄姬曰：『昨暮夜妾夢蒼龍據吾腹。』」《世說新語．賞譽》：「昨與士少語，遂使人忘疲。」 「 昨 」也泛指過去、過往。如東晉陶淵明〈歸去來辭〉：「寔迷途其未遠，覺今是而昨非。」唐代劉禹錫〈重至衡陽傷柳儀曹〉：「憶昨與故人，湘江岸頭別。」
From " day" to " at first" sound. " Yesterday" means the day before today. Such as "Historical Records. Family of Foreign Relations": "The King of Han has a miserable heart, and pity Bo Ji, it is a lucky day to call. Bo Ji said: "Last evening night, my concubine dreamed that the blue dragon took possession of my belly." "Shi Shuo Xin Yu. "Appreciation": "Talking to scholars yesterday makes people forget their fatigue." " Yesterday" also refers to the past and the past. For example, Tao Yuanming of the Eastern Jin Dynasty "Returning Words": "It is not far to be lost. I feel that today is true but yesterday is not." Liu Yuxi of the Tang Dynasty "Remembered yesterday and his old friend, the first farewell to Xiangjiang River."

昨字的基本解释

昨
zuó
今天的前一天，亦泛指过去：昨天。觉今是而昨非（感到现在这样是对的，过去是错误的）。

昨字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zuó］
［《廣韻》在各切，入鐸，從。］
(1)前一天；隔天。
(2)以前；过去。
(3)通“酢”。以酒回敬。

昨字的英文翻译

◎ 昨
yesterday

昨字的康熙字典解释

【辰集上】【日字部】　昨； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页493第14
【唐韻】在各切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】疾各切，?藏入聲。【說文】累日也。【廣韻】昨日，隔一宵也。【莊子·外物篇】周昨來，有中道而呼者。　又姓。【廣韻】複姓有昨和氏。　又與酢同。【周禮·春官·司几筵】祀先王昨席亦如之。【註】昨，讀曰酢。

昨字的源字形

昨字的起名意思

隔夜，上一天。

Yesterday
Basic explanation of words
Yesterday
zuó
The day before today also refers to the past in general: yesterday. Feeling that today is right and yesterday is wrong (feeling that this is right now and wrong in the past).
Yesterday

[①]［zuó］
["Guangyun" in each cut, enter the priest, follow. ]
(1) The day before; the next day.
(2) Before; in the past.
(3) Through "酢". Repay with wine.

zuó
I сущ./наречие
1) вчерашний день, вчера, вчерашний; накануне
昨暮 вчера (накануне) вечером
昨已会面 уже встречались накануне
2) прошлый год; прошлогодний, прошедший
昨夏 прошлым летом
3) прежнее время, прежний; прежде
昨失 прежние неудачи (промахи)
II собств.
Цзо (фамилия)
Radicals: 日, 乍  (sun, key)
Meaning Mnemonic
With the right key you can unlock the sun to yesterday, or a previous day. The sun is in charge of the day changes, so if you use a key to unlock it, you can control the flow of time and return to yesterday, or a previous day in the past. Behold the power of the sun.
Imagine having the power to control time like this. Picture yourself unlocking the sun to go back in time. Feel the heat of the sun and the bright light in your eyes as you unlock the door to the past.
Reading Mnemonic
Time traveling to a previous time, like yesterday, can be rough on the body. As such, you wear a small sack (さく) to hold your valuables while you’re ripped through the sands of time. The sack keeps your important stuff from getting lost. The sack holds your key to the sun as well.
Imagine wearing this sack as you’re sucked through the vortex of time and space. Feel yourself spinning around as you hurtle back into yesterday.
